app.containers.CookiePolicy.advertisingC: As CitizenLab, we donâ€™t use advertising tools on the participation platforms, but some (local) governments and organisations do. {advertisingLink} is the most used tool for this. This allows them to learn what type of users took certain actions, and to build Facebook advertising campaigns based on that knowledge.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.analyticsCon: We only use mass analytics. Meaning that no individual data are used, and that youâ€™re browsing our platform anonymously. These aggregated data, or mass analytics, show us which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the platform. This is necessary information for continuous improvement of the user experience. {analyticsLink} is our primary tool for analytics.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.changePrefer: At any time, you can change your preferences {changePreferencesButton}.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.contactInfo: Further questions or remarks? You'll find us here: support@citizenlab.co.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.cookiePolicy: A detailed explanation of how we use cookies on this platform
app.containers.CookiePolicy.cookiesList: You can find a full, up-to date list of 3rd parties and manage your preferences {cookiesListButton}.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.functionalCo:
As with the analytics cookies, these cookies donâ€™t â€˜know who you areâ€™. 
Important to stress though, is that they do track technical data, such as a browser info, approximate location and an IP address. Although they are not used in such a way, in combination with other data sources, this could lead to an identification. 
What are these functional cookies used for?
The main functional tool we use in this regard is {functionalLink}. This tool allows us to talk to you in a direct manner when visiting the platform. This way, we could show you around, ask for feedback on the platformâ€¦ The cookie allows us to continue this conversation when you come back. Off course, still without knowing who you are. When logged in, we use them to be able to send you in-app and email notifications on certain events relevant to you. These notification settings can be changed at any time on your user profile page.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.intro: As most websites, we use cookies to optimise the experience you and other visitors have on this platform. Because we want to be fully transparent on the why & how of this cookie use, youâ€™ll find all details below, in as clearly written wording as possible. Cookies used on our platform are never used to identify and track specific users, they donâ€™t "know who you are". Important to stress though, is that they do track technical data, such as a browser info, approximate location and an IP address. Although they are not used in such a way, in combination with other data sources, this could lead to an identification.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.whatAreCooki: Cookies are little text files which are stored on the browser or on the hard drive of your computer or mobile device when you visit a webpage or application. Cookies remember your actions and preferences. Logged in last time? A cookie will make sure youâ€™re automatically logged in the next time you visit us. Visited the platform two weeks ago? A cookie will prove helpful to highlight what has been added to the platform in the last two weeks. More info on cookies in general, can be found in {wikipediaCookieLink}.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.whatCookiesC: Several third party tools are used on each of our participation platforms. These tools in turn use cookies to be able to function.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.whoAreWeCont: We are {citizenLabLink}, a privately owned Belgian company. As software provider, we offer a digital participation platform to (local) governments and organisations. An example of such a platform is the one youâ€™re currently on.

containers.Admin.onboarding.HTMLDescript: This page will be your guide
containers.Admin.onboarding.decideArticl: Add topics to ideas, move them to the next project phase or change the idea status. Mark them as spam if they are offending.
Get immediate and easy-to-grasp analytics into whatâ€™s moving on the platform.
containers.Admin.onboarding.engageArticl: Send them an invitation and give them admin or moderator rights.
Import email addresses from people you want to invite. Add a personal message with a clear call-to-action to their invitation.
Create and send custom emails to inform your audience about new or upcoming events on the platform.
containers.Admin.onboarding.manageArticl: Give the participants feedback on their ideas by leaving a comment or sending an email.
Create groups to be able to contact specific groups or define permissions per group.
containers.Admin.onboarding.setupArticle: Projects are the beating heart of the platform. Admins and project moderators can customize and edit the projects at any time.
You can ask your users additional information while registering. Use these registration fields to gain insights or to segment your users into groups.
A personalized widget brings people from other websites to your platform.
Add a widget to your website
